comments:
On all of my projects, if I select an ant file and choose 'run ant...', the
resulting ant dialog box shows the error "cannot inherit from final class", and
a "red x" is marked on the targets tab.

Also, if I show the ant view in any perspective, for any project, all buildfiles
have the "red x", and specify the same "cannot inherit from final class" message.

If I remove the buildfile location in the wizard, the message goes away in favor
of the "location cannot be blank", but as soon as I enter any file (even a
non-ant file) in that box, the "cannot inherit" message returns.

Other developers are using the same ant files with the same version of eclipse
(2.1.1 build 200306271545) with no such problems.

WTH?

I opened the eclipse log file in my workspace, and found entries like this:

From the stack trace it looks like you are picking up a different set of Xerces 
class lilibraries. Eclipse's Ant integration must use the Xerces libraries 
provided in the Xerces plugin. This means that Xerces cannot be on the bootpath 
of the VM that you start Eclipse with and Xerces cannot be on the Ant runtime 
classpath (either directly or indirectly).  I would investigate the differences 
here between yourself and your co-workers.

Your comment sounds right.  I went the reinstall eclipse route, and that seems
to have fixed it.  It may have been a problem with an old plugin or somesuch.

(should this be fixed or wontfix, since it wasn't a bug, precicely?)
I take credit for a fixed :-)
